metadata.Title: CVE-2021-43400 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in gatt-database.c in BlueZ 5.61. A use-after-freecan occur when a client disconnects during D-Bus processing of a WriteValuecall.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-43400` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bluetooth - 5.62-0ubuntu1
bluez - 5.62-0ubuntu1
bluez-cups - 5.62-0ubuntu1
bluez-hcidump - 5.62-0ubuntu1
bluez-meshd - 5.62-0ubuntu1
bluez-obexd - 5.62-0ubuntu1
bluez-tests - 5.62-0ubuntu1
libbluetooth3 - 5.62-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: bluez package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.62-0ubuntu1').
